summary: PRRS is characterized by severe reproductive failure in sows and respiratory syndromes and persistent infection in young pigs. atypical PRRS is characterized by high fever, high morbidity, and high mortality in pigs of all ages. RNA interference (RNAi)-based therapies have been widely studied for treating fatal disorders or virus infection (20) however, most studies of viral infection in vivo have been based on exogenous small interfering RNAs (siRNAs) rather than host miRNAs except one case in which host miR-122 was confirmed as a target for HCV treatment by therapeutic silencing of endogenous miR-122 in HCV-infected primates. peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) were isolated from SPF pigs by Ficoll-Paque (Sigma) density gradient centrifugation according to manufacturer's instructions. peritoneal macrophages were obtained by lavage of the peritoneal cavity of SPF pigs. the cDNA was amplified with pfx DNA polymerase (Invitrogen) in 20 cycles of PCR using Illumina's small RNA primers selecting for 80- to 115-bp products on a 12% Tris-borate-EDTA (TBE) PAGE gel. a total of 10 l was sequenced on an Illumina GAIIx system following the vendor's instructions. miRNA target prediction and conservation analysis. miRNA mimics are double-stranded RNA oligonucleotides modified by 2′-O-methyl with sequence complementary to the mature miRNA annotated in miRBase. for miR-181 mutants, the corresponding non-seed-mutated miR-181a mimic (L1U, L9U, and L1L9U) or seed-mutated miR-181 family mimic (a-m, b-m, c-m, negative-control (NC) mimic sequence is as follows: 5′-UUC UCCGAACGUGUCACGUTT-3′. all miRNA or NC mimics were transfected into PAMs or Marc-145 cells at a concentration of 60 nM. universal adapter primer (5′-GCGAGCACAGAATTAATACGACTATAGGTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTVN-3′) diluted 40-l cDNA was then diluted in RNase-free water (1:20) 9 l of the diluted cDNA was amplified using a FastSYBR mixture (CWBIO) for detection of 2′-O-methyl-modified miR-181. expression levels were analyzed using the Ct method (37), and glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase (GAPDH) mRNA was set up for use as an endogenous control. all PCR experiments were done in triplicate. PBMCs were isolated from SPF pigs by ficoll-Paque (Sigma) density gradient centrifugation according to manufacturer's instructions. deep sequencing was performed by LC Sciences (Houston, TX) on PAMs inoculated with a mock dose or with PRRSV CH-1a at a multiplicity of infection (MOI) of 1 for 24 h. cDNA fragments 15 to 50 nucleotides (nt) in length were isolated by the use of a denaturing PAGE gel. miRNA targets in PRRSV JXwn06 or CH-1a RNA were predicted by RegRNA (32) or ViTa (33) for conservation analysis, we aligned targeting sequences in 171 virus strains. miRNA mimics are double-stranded RNA oligonucleotides modified by 2′-O-methyl with sequence complementary to the mature miRNA annotated in miRBase. the negative-control (NC) mimic sequence is as follows. all the miRNA or NC mimics were transfected into PAMs or Marc-145 cells at a concentration of 60 nM. MMLV reverse transcriptase was used for reverse transcription according to manufacturer's protocol (Promega) qPCR analysis was performed using a ViiA 7 real-time PCR system (Applied Biosystems) and a FastSYBR mixture (CoWin Biotech Co., Ltd. [CWBIO]. qPCR primers were designed for quantitative analysis of genomic and subgenomic mRNAs. all the forward primers were the same because genomic and subgenomic mRNAs share the same leader sequence. the PCR replicon was designed to be smaller than 250 bp. digested with 1 l of Dpn-1 for 1 h at 37°C. the remaining DNA was used to transform DH5 (TaKaRa) the remaining DNA was used to transform DH5 (TaKaRa) 2 protein, PAM lysates were produced using radioimmunoprecipitation assay (RIPA) lysis buffer supplemented with protease and phosphatase inhibitors. equal amounts of the samples were loaded and subjected to SDS-PAGE, transferred onto polyvinylidene difluoride (PVDF) membranes, and then blotted as previously described. at day 5 post-PRRSV infection, second deliveries of NC mimics or miR-181c mimics were performed using the same dose and route as the first time. the rectal temperature of each pig was monitored daily until it died. pigs were negative for the presence of PRRSV before virus challenge. qPCR (H) or subjected to Western blot analysis (I) in PAMs transfected with miRNA mimics for 24 h. qPCR analysis of IFN-, IFN-, or TNF- mRNA and viral ORF7 RNA from PAMs transfected with NC or miR-181a mimics and infected with PRRSV JXwn06 for 24 h. transfection of miR-181a mimics resulted in an over 80% reduction of the ORF7 gene expression of PRRSV CH-1a or JXwn06 strains. results from qPCR showed that all the miR-181 family members did have anti-PRRSV activity in PAMs. miR-181 inhibition was further confirmed to occur in a dose-dependent manner. mRNA level and protein level were significantly decreased as levels of introduced miR-181a mimics increased in PAMs. viral growth was inhibited much more significantly in PAMs infected with PRRSV at 24 h posttransfection than at 48 h or 72 h posttransfection. this suggests that cellular transcripts may competitively bind to miR-181c, resulting in exhaustion of introduced miR-181c. the results showed that miR-181c reached its maximum inhibitory effects at a dose of 60 nM. fected at a concentration of 60 nM, 300 nM, or 600 nM. pAMs from panel A were observed for development of CPE by bright-field microscopy at 84 h pi. inhibition of pGL3-Target-WT luciferase activity by miR-181 was diminished 20% to 30% by PRRSV infection compared to mock infection. the inhibition of pGL3-Target-Mut luciferase activity by miR-181 mutants was not affected. miR-181 family members (181a, 181b, 181c, and 181d) were cotransfected with reporter constructs and miRNA mimics. data are representative of the results of three independent experiments (means SD) miR-181c was significantly enriched to a 15-fold increase compared to the IgG isotype control level. results showed that miR-181c physically interacted with viral genomic RNA in the RISC. qPCR analysis of the relative expression of subgenomic mRNAs (sgRNAs) in comparison to genomic RNA (gRNA) among RNAs extracted from RISC immunoprecipitates of the cells. qPCR analysis showed that none of the miR-181 family members were abundant in PAMs. expression of miR-181c in peritoneal macrophages, microglias, and PBMCs was about 30-, 8-, and 2-fold higher than that in PAMs. qPCR analysis showed that none of the miR-181 family members were abundant in PAMs. miR-181 family or miR-21 levels from PAMs with mock infection or PRRSV JXwn06 infection for 24 h (24 h pi) qPCR analysis of miR-181 family levels in PAMs, microglias, PBMCs, or peritoneal macrophages isolated from specific-pathogen-free pigs. expression of miR-206 in peritoneal macrophages, microglias, or microglias was about 500-, 16-, and 14-fold higher than that in PAMs. the total expression of the 13 PRRSV-targeting miRNAs in peritoneal macrophages, PBMCs, or microglias was higher (1.5- to 2.4-fold increase) than that in PAMs. miR-206 was specifically expressed at a high level in muscle; miR-128, miR-181, and miR-338 were specific for brain; and miR-30-5p was specifically expressed at a higher level in kidney. estimates of total cumulative expression of 13 miRNAs in eight tissues from pigs infected with PRRSV JXwn06. qPCR analysis of viral ORF7 RNA from Marc-145 cells transfected with NC or miR-206 mimics and infected with PRRSV CH-1a for 24 h. data are representative of the results of three independent experiments (means SD) the miR-181c treatment group was given miR-181c mimics for a second time 5 days postinfection (dpi) it is well known that HP-PRRSV strain infection is characterized by high fever, high morbidity, and high mortality in pigs (1). the rectal temperature of each pig in the miR-181c group did not rise until 5 days after infection. two of the four pigs from the miR-181c group showed an extremely low viral RNA level at 3 dpi and then reached the viral RNA levels of the other two later at 7 and 10 dpi. survival curve showed that the miR-181c group survived significantly longer (20 days) than the control group (14 days) pigs treated with miR-181c survived significantly longer than control-treated pigs, 20 and 14 days respectively. data in panels A to D are presented as means SE. 145 cells transfected with NC or miR-181a mimics for 24 h. qPCR analysis of ORF7 RNA levels in PAMs transfected with NC or miR-181a mimics. qPCR analysis of IFN-, IFN-, or TNF- mRNA and viral ORF7 RNA. transfection of miR-181a mimics resulted in over 80% reduction of ORF7 gene expression of PRRSV CH-1a or JXwn06 strains. results from qPCR showed that all miR-181 family members did have anti-PRRSV activity in PAMs. the effect of miR-181 inhibition on PRRSV infection in PAMs was confirmed in a dose-dependent manner. we transfected miRNA mimics into PAMs infected with or without PRRSV. miR-181c showed the strongest inhibition of PRRSV replication. viral growth was inhibited much more significantly in PAMs infected with PRRSV at 24 h posttransfection than at 48 h or 72 h posttransfection. cellular transcripts may competitively bind to miR-181c, resulting in exhaustion of introduced miR-181c. miR-181c significantly relieved the PRRSV-induced cytopathogenic effect in PAMs. pAMs from panel A were observed for development of CPE by bright-field microscopy at 84 h pi. pGL3-Target-WT, a reporter construct containing the predicted target site region in the 3′ UTR, and another construct, pGL3-Target-Mut, with mutations of four nucleotides. inhibition of pGL3-Target-WT luciferase activity by miR-181 was diminished 20% to 30% by PRRSV infection compared to mock infection. but inhibition of pGL3-Target-Mut luciferase activity by miR-181 mutants was not affected. lysates of Marc-145 cells infected with PRRSV CH-1a at an MOI of 0.1 or 1 were cotransfected with reporter constructs and miRNA mimics. data are representative of the results of three independent experiments (means SD) miR-181c physically interacted with viral genomic RNA in the RISC. qPCR analysis of subgenomic mRNAs in comparison to genomic RNA (gRNA) among RNAs extracted from total samples of lysates from PAMs transfected with NC or miR-181c mimics. PRRSV has a tropism for cells of the monocyte-macrophage lineage. it replicates preferentially in PAMs and subsets of macrophages. qPCR analysis showed that none of the miR-181 family members were abundant in PAMs. miR-181c expression was approximately 1,000-fold lower than that of miR-21. miR-181 family or miR-21 levels from PAMs with mock infection or PRRSV JXwn06 infection for 24 h (24 h pi) qPCR analysis of miR-181 family levels in PAMs, microglias, PBMCs, or peritoneal macrophages (Peritoneal M) isolated from specific-pathogen-free pigs. expression of miR-206 in peritoneal macrophages, microglias, and PBMCs was about 500-, 16-, and 14-fold higher than that in PAMs. the total expression of the 13 PRRSV-targeting miRNAs in peritoneal macrophages, PBMCs, or microglias was higher (1.5- to 2.4-fold increase) than that in PAMs. miR-206 was specifically expressed at a high level in muscle; miR-128, miR-181, and miR-338 were specific for brain. miR-30-5p was specifically expressed at a higher level in kidney. estimates of total cumulative expression of 13 miRNAs in eight tissues. dose dependency of downregulation of ORF7 gene expression was observed in PAMs transfected with the indicated dose of miR-206 mimics and infected with PRRSV CH-1a for 24 h. data are representative of the results of three independent experiments (means SD) the rectal temperature of pigs in the miR-181c group did not rise until 5 days after infection. the temperature of pigs in the control group rapidly rose to 40°C at 2 dpi. the average viral RNA load in serum was 100- to 300-fold lower in the miR-181c group than that in the control group at 3, 7, and 10 dpi. two of the four pigs from the miR-181c group showed an extremely low viral RNA level at 3 dpi and then reached the viral RNA levels of the other two later at 7 and 10 dpi. survival curve showed that the miR-181c group survived significantly longer (20 days) than the control group (14 days) pigs treated with miR-181c survived significantly longer than control-treated pigs, 20 and 14 days respectively. cellular miRNAs have been identified to target viruses in host cells in many reports (3, 5–9). cellular miRNA-mediated RNAi could play an important role in controlling PRRSV replication. cellular miRNAs may influence viral tropism in the natural context. miR-181 interaction with PRRSV might be just a natural phenomenon. cellular miRNAs may influence viral tropism in the natural context. miR-181 and miR-338 were abundant in brain, at a level that was about 5 times higher than that in lung, whereas virus load in lung was about 100 times higher than in brain. cellular miRNAs proposed in this work might be associated with PRRSV tropism or viral replication capacity. the predicted target region for miR-181 is highly conserved in type 2 PRRSV. the predicted target region for miR-181 is highly conserved in type 2 PRRSV. the predicted target region for miR-181 is highly conserved in type 2 PRRSV. a 104- to 105-fold reduction of virus load compared to control pig results. the load was about 2 to 5 102-fold lower than in the other two miR-181c-treated pigs. however, in the late period of the experiments, it appeared that PRRSV replication could not be controlled.
